title: fantastico
review: awesome place to hangout. Lots of things to enjoy. Beautiful thing to see. sorroundings were awesome and

title: Peaceful full place
review: I love this place since 12 grade . This is a beautiful place for peace of mind and lovely atmosphere .

title: Good for Lazy Day
review: Initially i was unaware of this place but was suggested by one local person to visit if have some time and want to visit the place with less crowd with peace of mind. I visited in evening after hectic day with Taj visit and was refreshed

title: St. George Cathedral
review: Just drive through but it's nice to see Cathedral around this city of  Muslim majority and someone can drop by too.

title: St George's Cathedral
review: St Georges's Cathedral is a nice church built during the British Raj. The church is maintained quiet well and the surroundings are neat and clean. We visited the place as we happened to staying in the Cantt area during our Agra visit.

title: Great Cathedral
review: St Georges's Cathedral is built during the British rule. Inside the church are commerations to various officers. The surroundings are neat and clean. The church is maintained quiet well.

title: A place where prayers have been prayed.
review: Visited twice for worship. Warmest of welcomes. Fascinating architecture. It looks like a small St Paul's outside the walls in Rome when inside. Note the holes in the pews provided for soldiers to stand guns!

title: Best Cathedral in Agra
review: Atleast in  hindu dominant state i get to see a cathedral which is also beautiful and quite big. been there fora couple of hours taking pictures before catching the train

title: Beautiful and Peaceful Cathedral
review: St Georges Anglical cathedral is beautiful to see with lots of carving in marble especially the bishop's chair- the cathedra. It is poignant to see the memorials to those who died during the colonial era, especially when they were children who died from disease. Enjoyed looking at the pews with the notches for placing a rifle for the soldiers. Beautiful Holy altar in white marble.

title: Lovely historic building.
review: This building is ordinarily kept locked but the care taker is happy to open up for you. Very atmospheric, holy place.

title: Must see
review: This is a beautiful example of a British Raj church. It is very looked after and the inside is a joy. It is not hard to find as it is in the Cantonment area. You can get permission to go inside locally as it is locked generally. Inside are commerations to various officers and other ranks who died in battle or otherwise whilst serving in India

title: Lord Shiva Temple
review: A religious temple of Hindus, about 1000 years old, worshipers of Lord Shiva visit here. In rainy season of July a fair is held here each year.

title: Old monument of old city
review: Though the city have many mugal era structures but still you can find a lot of other culture and religous monuments like this.
